string-array.item:
To determine your skin tye, you can try this easy blotting paper test at home. Firstly, press a piece of blotting paper gently against your forehead, nose, chin, and cheeks. Then, observe the amount of oil transferred to the paper.
 
 • If there is minimal to no oil transfer, you have dry skin. 

• If there is significant oil transfer, especially in the T-zone, you likely have oily skin. 

•If the oil transfer is primarily in the T-zone, with minimal to no oil on the cheeks,the your skin is considered to be combination skin type.

Want to keep your skin looking its best? Here are the top 3 tips for healthy, radiant skin:
 
 1. Protect yourself from the sun. Sun exposure is the leading cause of premature skin aging and skin cancer. Use a broad-spectrum sunscreen with an SPF of 30 or higher every day, even on cloudy days and wear protective clothing.

 2. Cleanse and moisturise your skin and daily. Use a mild cleanser that is appropriate for your skin type. Wash your face twice a day, in the morning and at night. Moisturize your skin after you shower or bathe, and again as needed throughout the day. 

3. Eat a healthy diet. Eating a healthy diet that is rich in fruits, vegetables, and whole grains can help to improve your overall skin health. These foods are packed with nutrients that can help to protect your skin.

string-array.name: skin_condition_desc
string-array.item:
Acne is a common skin condition that causes spots or pimples on the face, neck, back or chest. 

 Tips:

 • avoid skin care products with alcohol 
 • wash face daily 
 •use an oil-free moisturizer 
 • get enough sleep 
 • eat a balanced diet

Cellulitis is a skin infection caused by bacteria. It can be warm, red, tender and very painful. 

 Tips:

 • keep skin clean and well moisturized 
 • avoid skin injuries such as cuts and scrapes 
 • keep your nails short

Ezcema is a condition that causes dry, itchy and inflamed skin. 

 Tips: 

 • moisturise your skin regularly 
 • avoid hot showers 
 • stay hydrated 
 • wear loose clothing

Melanoma is a type of skin cancer that can spread to other areas of the body.

 Tips:
 
 The main cause of melanoma is ultraviolet light, avoiding sun exposure and using a broad-spectrum sunscreen can greatly reduce the risk of melanoma.

Vitiligo is a chronic autoimmune condition that causes the skin to lose melanin.

string-array.name: medication_desc
string-array.item: Accutane is a medication primarily used to treat severe acne. It is also used to prevent certain skin cancers, and in the treatment of other cancers.
Clarinex is an antihistamine used to treat the symptoms of allergies, skin hives and itching in people with chronic skin reactions.
Clobetasol reduces swelling, redness, itching, or rashes caused by skin conditions, such as eczema and psoriasis.
Differin is primarily used in the treatment of mild-moderate acne, and is also used off-label to treat keratosis pilaris as well as other skin conditions.
Lotrimin is used to treat fungal infections such as yeast infections, oral thrush, diaper rash, tinea versicolor, athlete\'s foot and jock itch.
Minocin treats acne by killing the bacteria that infects pores and decreasing a certain natural oily substance that causes acne
Mirvaso is used for treating skin of the face affected by redness due to rosacea in adult patients.
